channel.title: Website Vote
channel.description: Hi im wanting to know if there is a way to make something where if you go onto my site it asks the person if they would like to vote and if they click vote it votes on moparscape. is that possible?

item.title: Website Vote
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

Moparisthebest:

And that would vote from the SERVER, which is limited to one vote per hour via IP. We are talking about making a page on your server to allow other people to vote without ever visiting moparisthebest.com, which I say is impossible, and Anthony seems to disagree.

ah, you’re right. i didn’t take into account the one vote per hour restriction, technically it’s still possible (since it is possible to spoof IPs), it would just be a lot of work.

Read full topic

item.title: Website Vote
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You might be able to create an applet that does the same thing as that PHP, but client sided, and host that on a web page

I don’t know how much Java supports of that stuff like fpassthrough, but someone could probably figure it out

Read full topic

And that would vote from the SERVER, which is limited to one vote per hour via IP. We are talking about making a page on your server to allow other people to vote without ever visiting moparisthebest.com, which I say is impossible, and Anthony seems to disagree.

item.title: Website Vote
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You can easily use PHP to spoof headers.

$thesearemyheaders = array( 'http' => array('method' => "POST",
'header'=> "accept-language: en\r\n" .  "Host: $host\r\n" .
  "Referer: $moparisthebestreffererurl\r\n" .
  "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n" . "Content-Length: 33\r\n\r\n" . "POSTshithere\r\n"));
$stream = stream_context_create($thesearemyheaders);
$f = fopen($statuspagevotesubmiturl, 'r', false, $stream);
fpassthru($f);
fclose($f);

Read full topic

item.title: Website Vote
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:10, topic:392585"][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=489757.msg3588197#msg3588197 date=1304369276]

Well it’s certainly possible to get them to vote by redirecting them to moparisthebest.com to vote for your server. Not for them to vote without coming to this site though.

why not, just grab the captcha embed it into their site, press vote and it POSTs to your voting page.

I check the referrer, so you can’t POST to my page from any other page besides mine.

spoof the referrer?

You can’t do that from a web page though, right? Weren’t we talking about people with pages voting on moparisthebest.com without being on moparisthebest.com? Not about people modifying their browsers.
[/quote]

sure you could, you can create your own POST request to the vote page and the referer is part of the HTTP header, so just spoof that sucker and voila.[/quote]

You can create a POST request to the vote page from your site, sure, but then I check the referrer, which shows you didn’t come from where you should have, and redirect you to my page. A page on a server cannot force a browser to spoof the referer header, which comes from the browser, it isn’t possible. The server has no power whatsoever over the headers a client sends.

Read full topic

Well it’s certainly possible to get them to vote by redirecting them to moparisthebest.com to vote for your server. Not for them to vote without coming to this site though.

why not, just grab the captcha embed it into their site, press vote and it POSTs to your voting page.

I check the referrer, so you can’t POST to my page from any other page besides mine.

spoof the referrer?
[/quote]
You can’t do that from a web page though, right? Weren’t we talking about people with pages voting on moparisthebest.com without being on moparisthebest.com? Not about people modifying their browsers.[/quote]

sure you could, you can create your own POST request to the vote page and the referer is part of the HTTP header, so just spoof that sucker and voila.

Read full topic
